definition.text:
1. A loose outer garment worn over other clothes both by men and women.He was clad with zeal as a cloke Isaiah 5 9:1
7.
2. A cover; that which conceals; a disguise or pretext; an excuse; a fair pretense.Not using your liberty for a cloke of maliciousness. 1 Peter 2:1 6.They have no cloke for their sin. John 1 5:22.CLOKE, verb transitive
1. To cover with a cloke
2. To hide; to conceal; to use a false covering.
